title: Drawing, "Theater Design: A Town Square", ca. 1719
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, blue and pale rose watercolor on white laid paper, laid down
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Courtyard surrounded by arcade in the background to the left building with dome and small towers either side, having appearance of a church but there are no ecclesiastical motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Theater Design: A Town Square", ca. 1719.
ca. 1719. Pen and brown ink, brush and gray wash, blue and pale rose watercolor on white laid paper, laid down. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-50.
